title: D.C. mayor 'focused' on RFK deal, not Trump talk
content: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser remains confident that the Commanders will return to the city but steered clear of President Donald Trump's threats to scuttle a stadium deal if the team does not return to its former name.

title: Hendrickson won't report to Cincy training camp
content: Bengals star defensive end Trey Hendrickson told ESPN that he will not report to training camp Tuesday with the rest of the team.

title: Ex-NFLPA boss resigns role at equity firm Carlyle
content: Former NFL Players Association executive director Lloyd Howell Jr. resigned his part-time consulting job with The Carlyle Group, one of a select group of league-approved firms seeking minority ownership in NFL franchises.

title: Injured Lillard glad to be 'back home' with Blazers
content: Damian Lillard spoke at a news conference Monday evening, saying it's meaningful to return to the city where he has spent most of his adult life.

title: Phillies win on catcher's interference call in 10th
content: Brandon Marsh scored on a catcher's interference call with the bases loaded in the 10th inning to give the Phillies a 3-2 walk-off win over the Red Sox.

title: Trade candidate Suarez continues homer binge
content: Eugenio Suarez, one of the most coveted bats ahead of the trade deadline, hit his fifth home run in three games for the Diamondbacks on Monday.

title: Cowboys' Parsons reports amid unsettled deal
content: Micah Parsons reported to training camp in Oxnard, California, on Monday, but what's not clear is whether Parsons will take part in practice when the Cowboys begin workouts Tuesday as he awaits a long-term extension.

title: Royals will call up Hill, 45, to start vs. Cubs
content: The Kansas City Royals plan to call up 45-year-old pitcher Rich Hill, who is 4-4 with a 5.36 ERA in nine starts for Triple-A Omaha, for a start against the Chicago Cubs on Tuesday at Wrigley Field, marking the left-hander's 21st season in the majors.

title: 🎵 LeBron appears in Tyler, The Creator video
content: LeBron James made an appearance in rapper Tyler, The Creator's music video for "Stop Playing With Me," released on Monday.

title: The worst decision every NBA team has made over the past five years, ranked 30 to 1
content: Zach Kram examines the deals, trades and picks that all 30 NBA teams would like to take back from the 2020s.

title: Randle-Towns trade, Bridges to New York and more: Regrading 2024 offseason moves
content: NBA expert Kevin Pelton looks back at 10 of the biggest trade and free agency moves and regrades them.

title: Let the deals begin! MLB trade deadline updates: Latest rumors and analysis
content: Which contenders will make the biggest splash? Here's what we're hearing as 6 p.m. ET on July 31 approaches.

title: 'We're a very dangerous team': What winning means for the Red Sox's trade deadline plans
content: Rising from under .500 to the thick of contention couldn't have come at a better time for the club's 2025 hopes.

title: 14 teams and loads of questions they must answer to win the 2025 CFP crown
content: The fewer things that must go right, the better a team's chances. Here's what has to fall each contender's way.

title: Power Rankings: Can Lynx sustain? Biggest second-half question for every team
content: Can New York catch Minnesota? How much will Caitlin Clark play? Here are the challenges facing each team.

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: Most of the NHL free agent deals are handed out July 1. But there are still some players left -- here are the top remaining unrestricted free agents.

title: Spain finally have all of Barcelona's midfield stars in top form together
content: Alexia Putellas, Aitana Bonmatí and Patri Guijarro have been unable to combine for Spain as they do for Barcelona. At Euro 2025, that is changing.

title: Petitti letter: Michigan sign-stealing penalties have gone far enough
content: Despite charges of serious NCAA rule violations, commissioner indicates sanctions have run their course

title: Numbers you need to know as you prep for draft day
content: Make of them what you will, but here are the stats from last season that you should be aware of as you prepare for your drafts.

title: Grading 50-plus NBA deals, including the CP3-Clippers reunion
content: Kevin Pelton breaks down the most impactful signings, including the Clippers bringing back Chris Paul.

title: Replacing Bellingham: How will Real Madrid cope without star midfielder?
content: Jude Bellingham is out for 12 weeks with a shoulder injury, so which Real Madrid players will have to step up in his absence?

title: Will Ekitike be a Liverpool hit or flop? Why he's so hard to scout
content: Hugo Ekitike is everything "dumb" clubs get wrong about transfers, and everything smart clubs get right.

title: Sources: Chelsea eye Garnacho; Man Utd drop value
content: Any potential Alejandro Garnacho transfer from Man United to Chelsea would depend on players first departing Stamford Bridge, sources have told ESPN.

title: Arteta: Nine teams could win Premier League title
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta said he believes his side have the "right ingredients" to end their 21-year Premier League title hiatus.

title: De Gea: Real Madrid move collapsed 'for a reason'
content: Former Manchester United goalkeeper David de Gea has said he will only reveal details of his failed move to Real Madrid once his career is over.

title: Sources: Mosquera to join Arsenal's Asia tour
content: Cristhian Mosquera is on his way to Singapore to join Arsenal's preseason tour after the club finalised terms with Valencia, sources have told ESPN.

title: Mbeumo: I used to wear Man United shirt as a kid
content: Manchester United's newest signing Bryan Mbeumo has said completing his move to Old Trafford is a "dream."

title: Sources: Man United to leave quartet off U.S. tour
content: Manchester United are set to axe Alejandro Garnacho, Antony, Tyrell Malacia and Jadon Sancho from their squad for the preseason tour of America, sources have told ESPN.

title: Source: Díaz wants to leave Liverpool  for Bayern
content: Luis Díaz remains determined to leave Liverpool this summer and hopes Bayern Munich will make a new offer to sign him, a source has told ESPN.

title: Barcelona to face Liga MX All-Stars in historic tie
content: Spanish champions Barcelona women will take on the top players of Liga MX Femenil in the inaugural 'Duelo de Estrellas' (All-Star Game) in Monterrey next month, the Mexican league announced on Monday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United, Man City fight for Sporting star Hjulmand
content: Sporting CP captain Morten Hjulmand is wanted by both Manchester United and Manchester City. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Pacquiao back in welterweight top 10; Usyk retains heavyweight top spot
content: Manny Pacquiao reclaims a spot in the welterweight rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: Scottie Scheffler's unique dominance over golf continues at Open Championship
content: Scheffler's march on Royal Portrush was a masterclass and proof that his approach is unlike anyone else's.

title: Waiver wire: Make some moves toward the Marlins
content: As the MLB season's second half gets into full swing, here are the players you should claim off the fantasy waiver wire.

title: Waiver wire: Maya Caldwell stepping up for Dream
content: Maya Caldwell is making the most of her increased opportunity with Rhyne Howard hurt for the Atlanta Dream and leads the list of fantasy pickups.

title: Restrictions on videography at Sabarimala to be tightened
content: Regulations on media coverage at Ayyappa temple  is set to be tightened further with Kerala High Court moving to expand existing restrictions on photography and videography within the temple premises

title: Leopard movement near Gandipet keeps foresters on tenterhooks
content: The latest sighting was reported from the Manchirevula village near Gandipet, from inside the sprawling campus of Greyhounds

title: We are ideological opponents not enemies: Fadnavis on Thackeray, Pawar
content: Maharashtra Governor releases book on Fadnavis, praised by Thackeray and Pawar, Fadnavis thanks them for their comments

title: ED officer interrogated by VACB in bribery case
content: He was summoned by the VACB after the Kerala High Court granted him anticipatory bail earlier this month

title: ₹800 crore for calamity works in coastal and Malnad regions
content: Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda has said that the State govt. will shortly approve these funds for taking up contingency works

title: Eliminate unnecessary animal studies, establish clear conditions for comparative clinical trials, say healthcare advocates
content: The 2025 Draft Guidelines on Similar Biologics offer an opportunity to advance India’s healthcare system, members of the Working Group on Access to Medicines and Treatment network said

title: Veerashaiva Lingayat mutts of Guru, Virakta traditions should come together: Somanna
content: The Minister of State for Railways has emphasised the need for the coming together of these mutts in the interest of the community

title: KLE Society hospital of Belagavi first to go paperless in State
content: In a record of sorts, the hospital has earned the credit of being the first fully paperless hospital in the State

title: YSRCP demands apology from TDP MLA for making derogatory remarks against former Minister
content: YSRCP leader Putta Shiva Shankar calls Bollisetty Srinivas’ comments against R.K. Roja an insult to women in public life and urged immediate withdrawal of the statements

title: High-level delegation to Delhi to seek cooperation of national political parties in passage of BC quota enhancement Bill
content: Deputy CM said the delegation will meet heads of all political parties during the monsoon session of the Parliament

title: Over 37 lakh dog bite cases, 54 human rabies deaths in 2024: Govt tells Lok Sabha
content: As per the information provided by the NCDC, the total dog bite cases in 2024 stood at 37,17,336 while the total 'suspected human rabies deaths' were 54.

title: Preparations for cooperative bank polls gain momentum in Belagavi
content: Leaders of different groups are organising meetings of their followers in rural areas of the district

title: While people mourns V.S. Achuthanandan, his sister watches in silence
content: Now 96 and bedridden, Azhikutty can no longer grasp the gravity of her beloved brother’s passing or respond to those around her

title: TTD sub-committee to explore feasibility of building Vaikuntam Queue Complex-III
content: Temple Trust Board sanctions ₹4.35 crore for daily Annadanam at Vontimitta temple, recommends regularisation of services of 142 contract drivers

title: Srisailam temple management steps up measures to prevent seasonal diseases
content: Temple EO directs officials to take steps to prevent breeding of mosquitoes, to chlorinate water as per standards, not let drinking water be contaminated, get the water tanks cleaned, and inspect water treatment plant for total dissolved solids levels

title: Farmers stage protest, seek clearance for Kalasa Banduri Project
content: The demonstration under the aegis of Kalasa Banduri Horata Samiti was staged in front of the office of Union Minister in Hubballi

title: Income Tax Appellate Tribunal rejects Congress’ appeal against tax demand on ₹199 crore income
content: According to the order, the Congress filed its income tax return for the financial year 2017-18 on February 2, 2019

title: Air India plane’s auxiliary power unit catches fire after landing at Delhi airport from Hong Kong
content: The airline spokesperson said there was some damage to the aircraft; passengers and crew safely disembark

title: India-U.S. trade deal: Deadlock over agri continues, but Trump surprise not ruled out
content: Officials anticipate a surprise from President Trump in U.S.-India trade negotiations, with agriculture and automotive components as key issues

title: BSF raises 'drone squadron' for Indo-Pak border post-Operation Sindoor
content: The decision to raise the unit was taken after a recent review of the strengths, weaknesses and threats facing the force post-Operation Sindoor.

title: Conveyed India’s concerns on Khalistani extremism to U.K., says Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri
content: ‘This Khaliastani issue) is a matter of concern not only to us but should be a matter of concern to our partners as well because this impacts social cohesion and social order in these other countries as well, said Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri.

title: 7/11 train bomb blasts case: Acquitted man demands re-investigation through SIT
content: Abdul Wahid Shaikh demands justice after being acquitted in Mumbai train bomb blasts case, exposing ATS falsehood

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: Jagdeep Dhankhar’s shock resignation prompts search for reasons; Opposition says there are ‘deeper reasons’ than health
content: Though there is no official word on what prompted the resignation, sources indicate it may have been linked to Mr. Dhankhar’s decision to accept a notice submitted by 63 Opposition MPs seeking removal of Justice Yashwant Varma.

title: Numbers stacked in the NDA government’s favour in vice-presidential polls
content: In comparison to the 2017 and 2022 vice-presidential elections, this time the government nominee is likely to have a lower victory margin.

title: Anantapur youth bag three National Jal Champion awards
content: Three youth were recognised for their exceptional commitment and impactful work in the field of WASH — Water, Sanitation and Hygiene

title: Three hockey trainers formally arrested after Odisha police find sufficient ‘proof’ of rape to proceed
content: Gang-rape cases rocked Odisha as two young girls were sexually assaulted in separate incidents in Jagatsinghpur and Malkangiri districts

title: Jagan, his wife Bharathi are kingpins in A.P. liquor scam, alleges AICC leader Manickam Tagore
content: The profit margin was artificially jacked up and commissions were routed through fake invoice and service contracts;   shell companies were floated in Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Visakhapatnam to launder the money, Mr. Tagore said

title: Indian cities need $2.4 trillion for climate infrastructure by 2050, World Bank says
content: The number of Indians living in cities is projected to nearly double to 951 million by 2050 from 480 million in 2020

title: Karnataka rains: Below normal rain in July puts Kodagu district on alert for ‘dreaded’ August
content: Heavy to very heavy rains in August means the hilly district ends up receiving 20 to 30 days of precipitation within a week, resulting in wide-spread damage to property, localized flooding and crop loss, apart from landslides

title: T.N. teenager kidnap case: Why has suspended ADGP not been summoned, Madras High Court asks CB-CID
content: Justice G. Jayachandran poses the question during the hearing of a bail petition filed by arrested accused; AAG says the ADGP has been summoned on July 24

title: Tribal women in Gujarat’s South Dang earn ₹35 lakh through Lakhpati Didi Yojana
content: The initiative is part of Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s national goal of creating 2 crore Lakhpati Didis — women earning at least ₹1 lakh annually through self-employment.

title: Nallapareddy Prasanna gets notice in case over remarks against Kovur MLA
content: A case has been filed under several sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita and Information Technology Act

title: No plan to scrap post-matric scholarship for ST/SC students: Centre
content: Both schemes are currently being implemented with funding and eligibility parameters approved by the Cabinet and Expenditure Finance Committee, which remain valid from financial year 2021-22 to 2025-26.

title: No reports of manual scavenging received from States, UTs: Govt
content: Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment Ramdas Athawale said the Ministry had commissioned a social audit in September 2023 to study sanitation worker deaths

title: Andhra Pradesh government sets up high-level panel to address concerns on district and mandal boundaries
content: The panel will examine in detail the representations made by citizens and their elected leaders, with regard to proposed changes in district names, boundaries, administrative headquarters, and related governance arrangements

title: Zero-fare tickets issued to women bus passengers cross 200 crore in Telangana
content: The scheme was launched in December 2023. It is applicable to women, children and transgender persons

title: Steering through history: E.V. Arjunan remembers his time as driver with V.S. Achuthanandan
content: From early morning rides to late-night returns, Arjunan chauffeured the veteran communist leader across Kerala, through political storms and quiet moments alike

title: Deputy Chairman Harivansh chairs Rajya Sabha proceedings after Jagdeep Dhankhar resigned as Vice-President
content: Rajya Sabha Deputy Chairman Harivansh leads morning session after Vice-President Dhankhar resigns due to health reasons

title: 8 Bangladeshi Nationals Detained In Assam's Bongaigaon
content: Eight Bangladeshi nationals were detained in Assam's Bongaigaon on suspicion of illegal border crossing and lack of valid documents on Tuesday.

title: Jailed J&K MP Allowed To Attend Parliament Between July 24 And August 4
content: A Delhi court on Tuesday granted to jailed Lok Sabha MP Engineer Rashid custody parole between July 24 and August 4 to attend the monsoon session of Parliament.

title: Inside Track On How J Dhankhar Ran Out Of Options, Quit As Vice President
content: Before Jagdeep Dhankhar announced his shock resignation as Vice President on Monday, citing health reasons, several moves were being made on the political chessboard behind the scenes that may have played a key role in the decision.

title: Stray Dog Bites 3 Women In College Campus Near Chennai
content: Three students were bitten by a stray dog on the campus of Tamil Nadu's Government Meenakshi College for Women, approximately 465 km from Chennai, on Monday, prompting calls for urgent action to prevent further attacks.

title: Bhupesh Baghel's Son Sent To 14-Day Judicial Custody In Liquor Scam Case
content: A special court here on Tuesday remanded Chaitanya Baghel, son of senior Congress leader and former chief minister Bhupesh Baghel, in a 14-day judicial custody in a money laundering case linked to the alleged liquor scam.

title: Madhya Pradesh Cop Dies By Suicide, Alleges Harassment In Chilling Videos
content: A 51-year-old assistant sub-inspector (ASI) of police, Pramod Pavan, allegedly died by suicide at his official quarters inside the Godan Police Station premises in Madhya Pradesh's Datia district early Tuesday morning.

title: Air India Hong Kong-Delhi Flight Catches Fire After Landing, Passengers Safe
content: The auxiliary power unit of Air India flight AI-315, flying from Hong Kong to Delhi, caught fire shortly after the plane landed at the Indira Gandhi International Airport, the airline said Tuesday.

title: US To Pull Out Of UNESCO Citing Anti-Israel Bias 2 Years After Rejoining
content: The United States announced Tuesday it will again pull out of the U.N.'s educational, scientific and cultural agency because it believes that its involvement is not in the country's national interest, and that the agency promotes anti-Israel speech.

title: Returning Home Is Just The First Step For Displaced Meitei Families In Manipur
content: After more than two years of heartbreak and displacement, several Meitei families made a poignant return to Kangchup, a village nestled in Lamshang subdivision of Imphal West district in Manipur.

title: Madras High Court's Big Order On Party Flagpoles In Public Spaces In Tamil Nadu
content: The Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court has ordered the maintenance of status quo on the removal of political flagpoles from public spaces, in a major relief to political parties, caste and community organisations across Tamil Nadu.

title: Free Trade Agreement, Investment Treaty On Agenda For PM Modi's Maldives July 25 Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's two-day State visit to Maldives this week will not only contribute further to consolidating strong ties between the two nations but also enhance peace, prosperity and security in the Indian Ocean Region (IOR),

title: Tirupati Temples Board Draws Up Plans To Expand Global Footprint
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam has decided to expand the global footprint of reigning deity Lord Venkateswara by building Srivari temples in various countries.

title: "Not In National Interest": US Leaves UN Cultural Body UNESCO
content: The United States on Tuesday announced it has left UNESCO, saying the UN cultural and education agency, best known for establishing world heritage sites, is biased against Israel and promotes "divisive" causes.

title: Indian Man Stripped, Assaulted In Ireland, Sparks Racism Row
content: An Indian citizen in his 40s was violently assaulted and partially stripped by a group of attackers in Tallaght, Dublin on Saturday. Ambassador of India to Ireland, Akhilesh Mishra, questioned and condemned the incident on X.

title: Lawyer Orders Veg Burger, Gets Chicken Cheese Burger. McDonald's Reacts
content: A lawyer ordered a vegetarian burger at a McDonald's outlet at an airport. However, what he received was a non-vegetarian burger and the man "unknowingly ate that too".

title: "In The Long Run, We Are Harming Maharashtra": Governor On Language Row
content: Amid the ongoing row over language in Maharashtra, Governor CP Radhakrishnan has urged people to refrain from spreading hatred based on linguistic differences, warning that such attitudes could harm the state in the long run.

title: Russia Putting Focus On Drone Attacks On Ukraine, Increasing Production
content: The long-range Russian drones come in swarms each night, buzzing for hours over Ukraine by the hundreds, terrorising the population and attacking targets from the industrial east to areas near its western border with Poland.

title: Humans Beat ChatGPT And OpenAI At Top Math Olympiad
content: Humans beat generative AI models made by Google and OpenAI at a top international mathematics competition, despite the programmes reaching gold-level scores for the first time.

title: India, Maldives Negotiate Free Trade Agreement, Investment Treaty
content: India and the Maldives are in discussions to negotiate a free trade agreement and an investment treaty, Indian Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri said.

title: Congress' Appeal Against Tax Demand Of Rs 199 Crore Dismissed By Tribunal
content: The Congress will not get any relief for the income tax demand to the tune of Rs 199 crore in party funds, pending from 2018-19.

title: Temple politics in Bengal: How Mamata is trying to counter BJP's 'Jai Ma Kali' push
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee is seemingly shifting towards a 'soft Hindutva' approach ahead of the 2026 elections. Following BJP's perceived consolidation of Hindu votes, Banerjee announced the 'Durga Angan' project, a year-round temple complex. This move, along with the Jagannath Dham inauguration, aims to counter BJP's religious narrative.

title: 18L dead electors, 7L duplicates: What EC has uncovered during Bihar SIR
content: The Election Commission of India has identified significant discrepancies in Bihar's electoral rolls following a Special Intensive Revision (SIR), including deceased, shifted, and duplicate electors. Despite legal challenges and Supreme Court scrutiny, the EC defends the SIR as crucial for ensuring the purity of elections by removing ineligible voters.

title: 'PM's non-post adds to mystery': Cong's jab at Centre over Dhankhar's exit
content: The Congress party is questioning Jagdeep Dhankhar's abrupt resignation as Vice President, suggesting the reasons are more complex than health concerns. They criticized PM Modi's brief response and highlighted the absence of key ministers from a crucial meeting chaired by Dhankhar.

title: Astronomer scandal: CEO quits; legal risk may be why HR head Kristin Cabot is not fired
content: Following a 'Kiss Cam' incident at a Coldplay concert, Astronomer CEO Andy Byron resigned, but HR head Kristin Cabot remains on leave, raising questions about her employment status. Legal and corporate considerations, including internal policies and potential legal risks, may be influencing the company's decision. Severance negotiations or Cabot's own account of events could also be factors.

title: Another Air India scare: Delhi-bound flight AI315 catches fire after landing
content: An Air India flight from Hong Kong to Delhi faced a mishap. Flight AI 315's auxiliary power unit caught fire after landing. The incident happened as passengers were disembarking. The APU shut down automatically. All passengers and crew are safe. The aircraft suffered some damage. Authorities have grounded the plane for investigation. The regulator has received notification about the incident.

title: The making of Kamboj: From McGrath's speed tips to Dhoni's calmness mantra
content: Anshul Kamboj, a 24-year-old Haryana pacer, has been called up as cover for the final two Tests against England, fulfilling his dream of wearing the India Test jersey. His coach, Satish Rana, describes him as a combination of MS Dhoni's calmness and Glenn McGrath's aggression, highlighting Kamboj's dedication and eagerness to perform.

title: 'He's a healthy man': CM Mamata casts doubt on reason for Dhankhar's exit
content: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee expressed doubt over VP Jagdeep Dhankhar's resignation citing his good health, fueling political speculation. Congress MP Jairam Ramesh suggested deeper reasons, possibly related to a BAC meeting incident. RJD alleged a BJP strategy involving Nitish Kumar, while the BJP dismissed all suspicions surrounding Dhankhar's sudden departure.

title: H-1B pay at Nike: Visa data reveals US software engineer salaries
content: Nike's H-1B visa data reveals software engineer salaries in the US, ranging from $139,845 to $301,378 based on specialization. The company's investment in tech roles reflects its digital transformation. While Nike sponsors roles in data, product, and design, primarily in Beaverton, Oregon, it's also undergoing restructuring, including tech division job cuts and outsourcing to third-party vendors.

title: New shield across Pak border as BSF raises drone squadron
content: The Border Security Force is establishing its first drone squadron to combat increasing aerial threats from Pakistan, especially after lethal drone attacks during Operation Sindoor. This unit, equipped with reconnaissance, surveillance, and attack drones, will be deployed at select Border Outposts along the India-Pakistan border.

title: 'Will do what we need to do': India takes tough stand on EU sanctions over Russian oil
content: Ahead of Prime Minister Modi's UK visit, foreign secretary Vikram Misri on Tuesday addressed concerns over Western pressure regarding Russian oil imports, emphasizing India's priority is its energy security. He cautioned against double standards in the global energy market, highlighting the need for balance and perspective amidst the European security crisis.

title: IND vs ENG | 'Not in spirit of the game': Gill slams England for time-wasting during Lord's Test
content: Indian Test captain Shubman Gill has criticised England's time-wasting tactics during the Lord's Test, deeming it against the spirit of the game. Gill highlighted Zak Crawley's delayed approach, ensuring only one over was bowled before stumps. Ahead of the fourth Test, Gill addressed injury concerns in the pace attack and hinted at Anshul Kamboj's potential debut.

title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk admits he had been ‘living in denial’
content: Elon Musk, acknowledging his past resistance to AI, has declared “game on,” signaling a more aggressive approach to the technology. This shift follows his earlier warnings about AI's potential dangers. Musk's renewed focus is evident through xAI, his startup competing with industry giants.

title: IND vs ENG: Will India retain Karun Nair for 4th Test? Skipper Gill gives update
content: Ahead of the crucial fourth Test, Captain Shubman Gill backs Karun Nair. Gill emphasises Nair's importance to the team. He believes Nair needs time to regain his form. The team management trusts Nair's experience. Old Trafford's surface may suit Nair's technique. All eyes are on Nair to deliver a strong performance. The team is working to ensure strong starts.

title: 'Late filing, cash donation violations': No relief for Cong in Rs 199 cr tax case
content: The Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) has dismissed Congress's appeal, upholding a tax demand of Rs 199.15 crore. The tribunal stated that Congress failed to meet the necessary conditions for exemption under Section 13A of the Income Tax Act, as the party filed its return after the due date and accepted cash donations exceeding the legal limit.

title: Ayesha Curry opens up: “Hours will go by…” on bond with husband — reveals secret to strong marriage
content: Ayesha Curry, entrepreneur and wife of NBA star Stephen Curry, recently shared insights into their strong relationship at the Create & Cultivate Festival. Promoting her Sweet July Skin lip treatment, she emphasized the importance of communication and teamwork in their marriage. Ayesha highlighted their early dating days, cherishing conversations that fostered a deep connection.

title: IND vs ENG | Stokes warns India on sledging ahead of 4th Test: 'Heat will be shown'
content: England captain Ben Stokes warns India about intense competition in the upcoming fourth Test. Stokes confirms Liam Dawson replaces injured Shoaib Bashir in the team. Dawson is making a comeback after 2017. Chris Woakes also returns after a break. India might give a debut to uncapped pacer Anshul Kamboj. The series is currently led by England 2-1.

title: 'Matter of concern not only to us': India flags Khalistan issue to UK
content: Foreign secretary Vikram Misri addressed the media, highlighting India's concerns regarding Khalistani extremists in the UK, a matter raised with British authorities. Discussions also involve the extradition of fugitives wanted by Indian law enforcement. Prime Minister Modi's upcoming UK visit, at the invitation of Prime Minister Keir Starmer, aims to review the comprehensive strategic partnership between the two nations.

title: VP election after Dhankhar's exit: How numbers stack up in Parliament?
content: India is set for a Vice Presidential election following Jagdeep Dhankhar's sudden resignation. The election, mandated to occur swiftly, will determine Dhankhar's successor, who will serve a full five-year term. The NDA holds a strong position to win, possessing a comfortable majority in both Houses of Parliament.

title: Is emotional abuse harder to prove? Psychologist on ‘unseen’ violence against elders
content: Emotional abuse in older adults, often unseen, manifests as criticism, neglect, or manipulation, inflicted by trusted individuals. Victims remain silent due to fear or shame, while subtle cues like sadness are dismissed. This mistreatment, stemming from communication breakdowns and societal biases, requires recognition, validation, and accessible support to break the silence and change the narrative of aging.

title: 'People who are saying ... ': Shashi Tharoor responds to Kerala Congress snub
content: Shashi Tharoor faced backlash from Kerala Congress leaders who accused sohim of undermining the party line and siding with the Modi government. Tharoor questioned the credibility of his critics and defended his stance, emphasizing national interest over party loyalty. Despite internal pressure, Congress leadership appears unwilling to expel Tharoor, suggesting he should leave on his own.

title: Watch: US cops smash Black man's car window, punch him in face at traffic stop
content: A Jacksonville officer, D. Bowers, faces consequences after a video surfaced showing him punching William McNeil Jr. during a traffic stop. McNeil was initially pulled over for allegedly driving without headlights. Sheriff T.K. Waters confirmed Bowers was relieved of duty and an internal investigation has been launched due to the viral footage and public outcry.

title: Saiyaara box office collection day 5: Mohit Suri film may see a slight drop on Tuesday, after...
content: Mohit Suri's directorial 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has become a surprise hit, exceeding expectations. The film recorded the highest opening day for newcomers and earned ₹83 crore in its first weekend, a record for a love story. Despite a Monday drop, it still made ₹24 crore, and by Tuesday afternoon, the total collection reached ₹113.

title: IND vs ENG | 'That was out of character': Ponting on Gill controversy at Lord's
content: Ricky Ponting has voiced his support for Shubman Gill following a heated exchange with England's openers during the third Test at Lord's. Ponting acknowledged Gill's uncharacteristic aggression, attributing it to his desire to assert himself as captain and defend his team. He drew comparisons to Virat Kohli's leadership style, noting the pressures of playing in England.

title: 1,906 toilets, but where? Gujarat RTI activist flags Rs 2cr scam
content: A significant scam has been uncovered in Bharuch district, Gujarat, involving the misappropriation of approximately Rs 2 crore intended for toilet construction under government assistance programs. Retired schoolteacher Pravin Modi exposed the fraud through an RTI application, revealing that documents, including Aadhaar cards submitted for marriage certificates, were fraudulently used to apply for funds.

title: Gabrielle Union says "My body failed me" — surrogacy felt like public humiliation; shares emotional journey
content: Dwyane Wade and Gabrielle Union faced significant challenges in starting a family. Union recently shared her emotional struggles with Marie Claire, revealing that miscarriages and the subsequent surrogacy journey took a toll on her mental health. She described the experience as feeling like a "f---ing public humiliation" when it didn't go as planned.

title: Chess | Carlsen’s awkward reaction to Niemann’s entry at award ceremony goes viral - Watch
content: At the Freestyle Chess Grand Slam in Las Vegas, Levon Aronian secured his first title, defeating Hans Niemann in the final and earning $200,000. A notable moment occurred when Magnus Carlsen conspicuously did not applaud Niemann during the award ceremony, reigniting their ongoing feud, but warmly applauded Aronian. Carlsen recovered to win the third-place match against Nakamura.

title: Taylor Swift wins over Ed Kelce: “She is a very special person”; Travis Kelce’s dad praises pop icon
content: Taylor Swift's relationship with Travis Kelce is blossoming, evident in her connection with his family. Ed Kelce, Travis's father, praised Taylor's caring nature, recounting a humorous initial recognition mishap. Reciprocally, Travis supported Taylor's father, Scott Swift, during his recent surgery. As Taylor maintains a low profile, Travis prepares for the upcoming NFL season, showcasing a deepening bond between the couple.

title: Chandigarh: 87-year-old retired top cop refuses to miss a day of cleaning
content: Despite retirement, 88-year-old Inderjit Singh Sidhu, a former DIG of Punjab Police, dedicates his mornings to cleaning Chandigarh's streets. Disappointed by Chandigarh's second-place ranking in the Swachh Survekshan 2024, he proactively picks up roadside garbage in Sector 49.

title: ‘Murdering democracy’: Priyanka Gandhi slams government over Bihar SIR row
content: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra has strongly criticized Bihar's Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls, alleging the BJP-led government is undermining democracy. Joined by other INDIA bloc leaders, including Rahul Gandhi and Akhilesh Yadav, she protested at Parliament, accusing the government of suppressing votes.

title: From ‘beautiful bills’ to economic revival: Trump marks 6 months in office
content: President Trump's second term has seen significant policy shifts, including substantial tax cuts and increased border security. The economy has added jobs primarily for native-born Americans, with rising blue-collar wages and substantial investment pledges. New trade agreements have been forged, and social policies have been implemented, addressing gender-affirming care and diversity programs, alongside initiatives promoting healthier food options.

title: 15-year-old alleges rape by hockey coaches in Jajpur
content: In Jajpur district, police have detained four hockey trainers following a harrowing gang-rape allegation. A 15-year-old aspiring hockey player reported the incident, stating it occurred after a coaching session on July 3. The accused allegedly took her to a lodge, where they overpowered and assaulted her, further threatening her into silence.

title: LeBron & Bronny James to join Warriors: NBA insider drops bombshell; Rumors over father‑son duo
content: NBA insider Zach Buckley suggests a shocking trade: LeBron and Bronny James to the Golden State Warriors for Jimmy Butler to the Los Angeles Lakers. This move could pair LeBron with Stephen Curry, creating an unstoppable offensive force. Meanwhile, Butler's arrival in Los Angeles would provide Luka Doncic with crucial support and defensive stability.

title: 'Both sides committed to elevate partnership': MEA on PM Modi’s UK visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit the United Kingdom and the Maldives, commencing July 23. In the UK, he will meet with Prime Minister Keir Starmer and King Charles III to strengthen the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership. Following this, PM Modi will travel to the Maldives for a state visit aimed at stabilising diplomatic relations with President Muizzu.

title: When Mohanlal wore a necklace, he wore vulnerability and dismantled gender norms
content: In a groundbreaking advertisement, veteran Malayalam actor Mohanlal challenges traditional gender norms by adorning himself with jewellery. The ad, by Vinsmera Jewels, showcases Mohanlal's comfort and joy in wearing the pieces, defying conventional portrayals of masculinity. This bold move has sparked widespread praise, prompting conversations about redefining masculinity and embracing personal expression.

title: 'Either you give everything or rest': Irfan Pathan to Jasprit Bumrah
content: Irfan Pathan has urged Jasprit Bumrah to elevate his performance in the crucial fourth Test against England, emphasizing the need for total commitment. Pathan highlighted Ben Stokes' and Jofra Archer's recent performances as examples of players pushing their limits for their team's success. He believes Bumrah's consistent match-winning contributions will solidify his legacy.

title: How EU ban on Russian-origin oil imports will hit India’s fuel exporters
content: The EU's upcoming ban on Russian-derived fuels, effective January 21, presents a temporary reprieve but poses challenges for Indian exporters due to its narrow classification. The EU requires proof of crude oil origin, potentially impacting fuel exports from India, a major importer of Russian oil.

title: Delhi tourist raped in McLeodganj hotel room
content: A tourist from Delhi was allegedly raped in her hotel room near McLeodganj, Dharamshala, by Shubham, a friend of her employer. The survivor, who was visiting Kangra with friends, stated that Shubham barged into her room while she was alone and sexually assaulted her. Police arrested Shubham, a Kangra native, after the woman filed a complaint.

title: Dhankhar's sudden exit: PM Modi wishes him good health
content: Prime Minister Modi conveyed his well wishes to Jagdeep Dhankhar, who stepped down from his position as Vice President due to health concerns. President Murmu accepted Dhankhar's resignation, and the Rajya Sabha acknowledged the Home Ministry's notification regarding the immediate effect of his departure.

title: Man in fur terrifies Japanese town after real bears kill two
content: A safety drill simulating a bear attack took place in Tochigi. This followed a tragic incident in Fukushima where a newspaper deliveryman died in a bear attack. The same bear was responsible for another death four years ago. Authorities issued a brown bear emergency alert. Hunting laws were eased. Residents are urged to be cautious and report sightings.

title: Bengaluru job lure: 56 women rescued from train in West Bengal
content: Authorities rescued fifty-six young women from a train at New Jalpaiguri station, suspecting human trafficking. The women, from West Bengal, were promised jobs in Bengaluru but were being sent to Bihar. Railway personnel noticed inconsistencies in their travel plans, leading to the arrest of two individuals accompanying the group, who failed to provide valid explanations or employment documents.

title: Kanwar Yatra: SC directs eateries to display only license & registration info
content: The Supreme Court has instructed dhaba and restaurant owners along the Kanwar Yatra route to adhere to Uttar Pradesh's mandate of displaying license and registration information. This directive follows a petition arguing that QR code requirements, revealing owner identities, could lead to discriminatory profiling.

title: England's semifinal record is the result of hard work and unity
content: england beat Sweden 1-0 in penalty shootout at euro 2025 . right back Lucy Bronze was asked if that was a "proper Lucy Bronze" performance . the match will be the sixth major semifinal in 10 years . defender isme Morgan came on against Sweden as a substitute .
